document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the Neotropical spider genus Nops MacLeay (Araneae: Caponiidae) with the first phylogenetic hypothesis for the Nopinae genera

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the Neotropical spider genus Nops MacLeay (Araneae: Caponiidae) with the first phylogenetic hypothesis for the Nopinae genera

bibRefCitation.refString: Keyserling, E. (1891) Die Spinnen Amerikas. Brasilianische Spinnen. Nurnberg, 278 pp.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
N. meridionalis :
Keyserling, 1891 : 24
, pl. 1, fig. 6. Male holotype from Taquara do Novo Mundo (currently Taquara), Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil, V. Ihering (NHM 498; examined).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 59 .
Nops meridionalis Keyserling
; A–D male (holotype); E–G female (paratype). A habitus, dorsal view. B left palp, prolateral view. C left palp, ventral view. D left palp, retrolateral view. E habitus, dorsal view. F external genital area, ventral view. G internal genitalia, dorsal view. Abbreviations: ap—anterior plate, ess—sclerotization around spiracles, lep—lateral extensions of posterior plate, pp—posterior plate, re—posterior receptaculum, ue—uterus externus. Scale bars: 2 mm ( A , E ), 0.5 mm ( B–D , F–G ).

FIGURE 60 .
Nops meridionalis Keyserling
; male (MCTP 27792). A cephalothorax, anterior view. B eyes, anterior view. C cephalothorax, lateral view. D cephalothorax, ventral view. E labium and endites, ventral view. F serrula, anterior view. G base of left endite, ventral view. H labium, ventral view. I tip of endites, anterior view. J chelicerae, anterior view. K same, lateral view. L right fang of chelicerae, lateral oblique view.

FIGURE 61 .
Nops meridionalis Keyserling
; male (MCTP 27792). A spinnerets posterior view. B same dorsal view. C ALS and PMS, dorsal oblique view. D minor ampullate gland spigot and aciniform gland spigots on left PMS, dorsal view. E minor ampullate gland spigot on right PMS, dorsal view. F anal tubercle, dorsal view. G left leg I, prolateral view. H left tarsus I, prolateral view. I left trochanter I, prolateral view. J left tarsus III, retrolateral view. K left pretarsal claws III, anterior oblique view. L tarsal organ on left tarsus III, dorsal oblique view. Abbreviations: aj—adesmatic joints, ar—arolium, ca—crista.

FIGURE 62 .
Nops meridionalis Keyserling
; A–F male (MCTP27792); G–L female (MCTP27792). A left tarsal claws IV, dorsal view. B same, anterior view. C unpaired claw on leg IV, anterior view. D left pretarsal claws IV, dorsal oblique view. E left pretarsal claws IV, retrolateral oblique view. F tarsal organ on left tarsus IV, dorsal view. G internal genitalia, dorsal view. H same, close up. I gland under the receptaculum, dorsal view. J internal genitalia, posterior view. K same, close up. L same, anterior view. Abbreviations: ap—anterior plate, pp—posterior plate, re—posterior receptaculum, ue—uterus externus.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis . Both sexes resemble the similar congener
Nops minas ,
which have a similar abdominal pattern as in figure 6I , and by having the PLS longer than PMS and the posterior unpaired claws small ( Fig. 5C ); but can be distinguished by a strongly curved embolus, longer than palpal tibia ( Fig. 59B, D ) in males, and a strongly sclerotized lep, remarkable ess and sclerotizations on lateral margins of anterior plate in external female genitalia ( Fig. 59F ).

Description . Male ( MCTP 21983): Carapace, sternum, legs and labium orange. Chelicerae, endites and coxae orange yellowish. Abdomen dorsally greenish gray, with the most common pattern as in figure 6I , ventrally light pale gray. Anal tubercle and spinnerets light gray. Total length 8.9. Carapace 5.2 long, 3.8 wide. Sternum 4.6 long, 3.6 wide. Leg measurements: I: 4.1; II: 4.05; III: 3.5; IV: 4.15. Posterior unpaired claws small, as in other three‒clawed spiders ( Fig. 62 A‒C ). PLS longer than PMS ( Fig. 61B ). Palp with an embolus longer than tibia, strongly curved at the first third forming a 90° angle, apical part swollen, the rest thin ( Fig. 59B‒C ; 63B‒C); tip with two ventral short extensions and a reborded dorsal margin ( Figs. 63D‒F ).

Female ( MCTP 27788). Carapace, chelicerae, labium, coxae, legs, endites and sternum as in male. Abdomen as in male ( Fig. 59D ). Anal tubercle and spinnerets whitish yellow. Total length 9.5. Carapace 5.5 long, 4.1 wide. Sternum 4.95 long, 3.8 wide. Leg measurements: I: 4.2; II: 4.15; III: 3.7; IV: 4.3. Posterior unpaired claws and PLS as in male. External genital area with strongly sclerotized anterior plate, strongly sclerotized lep and remarkable ess ( Fig. 59F ). Internal genitalia with wide invagination on receptaculum and uterus externus with narrow base ( Figs 59F ; 62J‒L).
Distribution . Known from the Brazilian States of Santa Catarina and Rio Grande do Sul ( Fig. 59H ).
